Population: {{Ua-pop-est2013|35,320}}. The population in 2001 was 35,968.
==History== There are traces of an old [[Kievan Rus']] settlement, including the remains of an ancient cemetery. The railway reached the town in the 1860s, after which it became a favourite resort for artists and writers, including the composer [[Mykola Lysenko]] and the writer [[Sholom Aleichem]]. The fictional village of Boyberik, where Aleichem's tales of ''[[Tevye the Milkman]]'' are located, is based on Boyarka.<ref>Ivchenko (2007), p. 61</ref>
==Present-day Boyarka== The Kiev Oblast [[orphanage]] is located in Boyarka.<ref>[http://www.life2orphans.org/boyarka.htm Webpage of Life2Orphans]</ref>
The town is also the location of the Boyarka [[Metrology|Metrological]] Centre, owned by the company [[Naftogaz]], which provides [[calibration]] services for [[flow measurement|gas-flow]] meters.<ref>Brochure ''Metrological Centre NJSC "Naftogaz of Ukraine" '', Kiev, 2009</ref>
During the years 2005 to 2007, the town hosted the now-defunct football club, [[FC Inter Boyarka]].
